author: nepean
title: Found at Target - Nov 2010
review: I found this polybag set at Target today. They were hanging by each register with the other toys and impulse items. Every check out line had some on a hook.  Looks like a fun little set, my son will be happy to find it in his Christmas stocking.

author: c_lee_r

review:

comes with extra pieces, small prop, clear blue and yellow stud, visor, technic piece, and tail shaft piece.

author: AETerry
title: Disappointed
review:
That pretty much sums it up for me with this set. It was an impluse buy in the checkout line when getting other sets.

 

I've gotten one other Fire Helicopter over the years, 6531 Flame Chaser that despite it's age and dating back to 1991 is a far better build then this model is. 4900 is just way too small IMHO to be functional, even though it is a toy.

 

Who ever designed this set I think tried to hard to incorporate many of the new element or brick pieces into it. The set's saving graces are a number of extra pieces I happened to get when opening this. Extra visor, extra light pieces, tail propeller and technic pieces for the tail.

author: clundsberg
title: A kinda sentimental buy.
review:
My son received this as a gift and it reminded me very much of my first Lego mini-fig set Fire Copter 1 from 1982, tho with not as many pieces and and no cool hinged cockpit, this is definately not your father's fire chopper.

It does have a sleek design and some nice pieces and it's a neat add-on to any fire department's force.

Overall: Short n sweet describes the set as well as the build. A good set for a roadtrip or perhaps as an impulse gift.

author: thereders
title: Nice little Heli
review:
I got my two boys this little set at Target. It was set up at the checkout aisles. We build lots of legos so they always want new sets. This did the trick.

The one thing i didn't like was that it came apart pretty easily at the top where the windscreen and rotor attached to the body. Requires multiple fixes.

author: Maisy
title: Fire Helicopter adds alot to my new collection
review:
I really like this little set. I found it in Target today, in the checkout area (impulse buying stuff) ... when I have the time I try to check out more than one check out line for it's LEGO offerings. Usually it's just Atlantis and Ninja stuff, occasionally a Toy Story Army Soldiers set can be found. Today this was in the last aisle I checked (which was 4 of the aisles,) and it was just sitting there on the peg at the very front on the bottom side rack. I snatched it up immediately!

4900 Fire Helicopter goes nicely with the free-bee I got in September at the LEGO store (30012 Microlight) as well as with a little thing I created/built earlier that I call a Light Terrain Speedster (red, white, blue scheme) that can hold one mini-figure.

This Fire Helicopter fits the scale of the things above, plus fits the scale of my main collection, which is Alien Conquest. I like this piece, it adds some City support to the other City piece that can aide my ADU guys locally.

I'm not fond of the windscreen, it should be hinge-able, but it's not. There are two hinge pieces on the back of the Fire Helicopter, but nothing to go on them. You have to take the top off the piece to get the Mini-Figure in or out. It's not THAT much of a problem, just the MAIN issue I have with this set that could be different.

Lots of extra left-over pieces for a set of this size. Gotta love that.

All in all, I recommend this piece, especially if you have other City sets. I also think it's nice side support for the ADU side of Alien Conquest.

author: wii1232
title: A Small Set for a Large Price
review: I bought this set using fake checks at the 5th Grade Store at my elementary school a couple years ago, and it was the only LEGO set available.  So I took it for $45.00 thru checks!  It was a lot.  Overall, the exclusive pilot minifig was the best part.
